SEARCH
Package gw.datatype

Interface IConstrainedDataType

public interface IConstrainedDataType
Represents the constraints aspects of a datatype.

For the methods that take a context object of type Object and a property IPropertyInfo, these arguments represent contextual information that may influence the datatype's response. These arguments may always be null. It is the implementation's responsibility to deal with null for these arguments.

Author:
pdalbora

  • Method Details

    • getLength

      Integer getLength(Object ctx, IPropertyInfo property)
      Gets the maximum length for the datatype, for the given property on the given object. Returns null if the datatype has no maximum length.

    • getPrecision

      Integer getPrecision(Object ctx, IPropertyInfo property)
      Gets the precision for the datatype, for the given property on the given object. Returns null if this datatype has no maximum precision.

    • getScale

      @Nullable Integer getScale(Object ctx, IPropertyInfo property)
      Gets the scale for the datatype, for the given property on the given object. Returns null if this datatype has no maximum scale.

    • round

      BigDecimal round(Object ctx, IPropertyInfo property, BigDecimal decimal, RoundingMode roundingMode)
      Rounds the given decimal value to the scale required by this datatype, if applicable. Returns decimal if this datatype has no maximum scale, or if decimal already has the scale for this datatype. If the value needs to be rounded, it will be rounded according to roundingMode.

    • getRange

      Range<? extends Number> getRange(Object ctx, IPropertyInfo property)
      Gets the range for the datatype, for the given property on the given object. Returns null if this datatype does not have a numeric value type; i.e. a range is not applicable.

    • validateUserInput

      void validateUserInput(Object ctx, IPropertyInfo property, String strValue)
      Checks the given user-supplied string for validation errors.
      Throws:
      DataTypeException - if the value is invalid.

    • validateValue

      void validateValue(Object ctx, IPropertyInfo property, Object value)
      Checks the given value for validation errors.
      Throws:
      DataTypeException - if the value is invalid.
      ClassCastException - if the value is not of the datatype's value type.

    • isValidateOnSet

      boolean isValidateOnSet()
      Indicates whether the value should be validated on set. Most datatypes will want to validate values on set, but some may require reading multiple values in order to validate. Such datatypes will have their values validated later.

    • getLoaderIntegrityCheckPredicates

      String getLoaderIntegrityCheckPredicates(String columnName)
      Gets any related loader integrity checks for the given column, as a string. The string will be in the form <predicate_0> OR <predicate_1> OR ... OR <predicate_N>, and will be empty if there are no loader integrity checks associated with this datatype.

    • getConsistencyCheckerPredicates

      String getConsistencyCheckerPredicates(String columnName)
      Gets any related consistency checks for the given column, as a string. The string will be in the form <predicate_0> OR <predicate_1> OR ... OR <predicate_N>, and will be empty if there are no consistency checks associated with this datatype.

    • isMoneyBased

      boolean isMoneyBased()
      Indicates whether this datatype is money based. This method is used to distinguish money-based datatypes from other decimal datatypes.

    • getCurrency

      Currency getCurrency(Object ctx, IPropertyInfo property)
      Gets the currency associated with this value. Returns null if this is not a money based datatype, or if the value has no associated currency.
